Sequence Information.Peptide Name: M-zodatoxin-Lt2a (M-ZDTX-Lt2a; Latarcin-2a, Ltc-2a, Ltc2a; spiders, Arthropods, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.16735513]Gram-positive bacteria:Arthrobacter globiformis VKM Ac-1112 (MIC=0.7 µM), Bacillus subtilis VKM B-501 (MIC=0.4 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli DH5-alpha (MIC=1.0 µM), Escherichia coli MH1 (MIC=0.7 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (MIC=6.7 µM);Fungi:Pichia pastoris GS115 (MIC=6.7 µM), Saccharomyces cerevisiae Y190 (MIC=54 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.16735513]20% hemolytic activity at 6 μM against rabbit erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The molecule of Ltc2a is found to consist of two helical regions (residues 3-9 and 13-21) connected via a poorly ordered fragment.
Sequence Information.Function: Has hemolytic activity against Rabbit erythrocytes and has toxicity to ovarian insect Sf9 cells (EC50=20 µM). Causes paralysis, but is not lethal when injected into insect (Musca domestica) larvae.

Literature.Title: Latarcins, antimicrobial and cytolytic peptides from the venom of the spider Lachesana tarabaevi (Zodariidae) that exemplify biomolecular diversity.
Literature.Author: Kozlov SA, Vassilevski AA, Feofanov AV, Surovoy AY, Karpunin DV, Grishin EV.

Literature.Title: Spatial structure and activity mechanism of a novel spider antimicrobial peptide.
Literature.Author: Dubovskii PV, Volynsky PE, Polyansky AA, Chupin VV, Efremov RG, Arseniev AS.
